libraryItems.meaningful_description: The Math Reader "Mabel's Place" supports the unit "Understand Numbers 1−10." In this Reader, Mabel, a mouse, sells lemonade, and mice come to her café to drink. Illustrations encourage comparisons, such as whether there is the same number of mice as there is chairs.

The Math Reader "Flowers for Flossie" supports the unit "5-Groups in Numbers 6–10." In this Reader, Skip the skunk gathers flowers of several colors for Flossie. He counts the flowers of each color. He gives a bouquet of nine flowers to Flossie.

The Math Reader "Hippo and Fox Sort Socks" supports the unit "Teen Numbers as Tens and Ones." In this Reader, Hippo and Fox wash socks, and when they are dry, they sort them into big, small, and dotted groups.
libraryItems.display_title: Unit 3: Hippo and Fox Sort Socks

libraryItems.meaningful_description: The Math Reader "Where's the Party?" supports the unit "Partners, Problem Drawings, and Tens." In this Reader, Rick Robin lives in a birdhouse "apartment" shared with 19 other birds. He looks for a party that is in Home 19. He notes the order of the numbers in each row. He also notes numbered homes that are positioned before, after, and between other numbered homes.

The Math Reader "Under the Umbrellas" supports the unit "Consolidation of Concepts." In this Reader, Turtle has ten umbrellas. As it rains, animals who are getting wet come along, and Turtle gives them each an umbrella until he has given away all the umbrellas he had.
